data.name: Number Spiral - Square Warmup
data.description:
Imagine a a square (two dimensional) table on which we can place numbers from 1 to 1+size^2 (where the size is the size of the side of that table). 

Now, let's place those numbers of the table in a spiral, starting in the center or the nearest position to the bottom left from that centre (if the side length is even). The spiral goes first right, then up, left, down and so on until the whole table is filled. 

The objective is to calculate all values in the corners of the table for a given size. 

An example for `size=3`

```
5 4 3
6 1 2
7 8 9
```

expected result `[7,9,3,5]` 

An example for `size=4`

```
16 15 14 13
 5  4  3 12
 6  1  2 11
 7  8  9 10
``` 
expected result `[7,10,13,16]`

The size will be an integer between 1 and 999,999
This relates to [Ulam's Spiral](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulam_spiral).
